trans-unit.source: Represents a collection of string elements separated by commas.
This class cannot be inherited.
This class represents a string collection that is serialized as a comma-delimited list of string elements.
Creates a new instance of the <xref href="System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection"></xref> class.
Adds a string to the comma-delimited collection.
This method causes the <xref:System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection.IsModified%2A> property to be set to `true`.
A string value.
Adds all the strings in a string array to the collection.
The `range` parameter must be an array rather than a comma-delimited string.
An array of strings to add to the collection.
Clears the collection.
This method causes the <xref:System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection.IsModified%2A> property to be set to `true`.
Creates a copy of the collection.
A copy of the <xref href="System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection"></xref>.
Adds a string element to the collection at the specified index.
This method causes the <xref:System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection.IsModified%2A> property to be set to `true`.
The index in the collection at which the new element will be added.
The value of the new element to add to the collection.
Gets a value that specifies whether the collection has been modified.

The <xref:System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection.IsModified%2A> property is `true` after the <xref:System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection.Add%2A>, <xref:System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection.Clear%2A>, <xref:System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection.Insert%2A>, or <xref:System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection.Remove%2A> method has been called.

Also, the <xref:System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection.IsModified%2A> property is `true` after the <xref:System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection.Item%2A> property is used to modify an element of the string collection.
`true` if the <xref href="System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection"></xref> has been modified; otherwise, `false`.
Gets a value indicating whether the collection object is read-only.
This property returns `true` if the collection is marked as read-only.
This is useful for protecting the element at run time, as opposed to design time.
For more information, see the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement.IsReadOnly%2A> method on the <xref:System.Configuration.ConfigurationElement?displayProperty=fullName> class.
`true` if the specified string element in the <xref href="System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection"></xref> is read-only; otherwise, `false`.
Gets or sets a string element in the collection based on the index.
This property allows a string in the collection to be set or retrieved based on its index in the collection.
This property also causes the <xref:System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection.IsModified%2A> property to be set to `true`.
The index of the string element in the collection.
A string element in the collection.
Removes a string element from the collection.
This method causes the <xref:System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection.IsModified%2A> property to be set to `true`.
The string to remove.
Sets the collection object to read-only.

To determine whether the <xref:System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection> collection can be modified, call the <xref:System.Configuration.CommaDelimitedStringCollection.IsReadOnly%2A> method.
Returns a string representation of the object.
A string representation of the object.
